sub_title: MADE51 Project Officer at WFTO | Program & Impact Evaluation | Social Business Researcher
summary:
MA Economics of Development with a specialization in Econometric Analysis of Development Policies at the International Institute of Social Studies - Erasmus University Rotterdam; Professional in International Business with studies on Political Management & Governance and Sustainable Development.

 Seven (7) years of demonstrable working experience, in development economics research, applied research in social intervention methodologies for vulnerable, conflict-prone territories, program management of development programs, drafting and elaboration of productive transformation initiatives and projects. 


Proven track record of support, evaluation and heading of Sustainable Entrepreneurships initiatives and social enterprises in the sector of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (SMEs), necessity entrepreneurships and Youth public policy issues as mentor, consultor and professor across the public and private sector.

- Co-Founder and Programs Director of (2) entrepreneurship and social innovation “Magdalena Emprende” for young entrepreneurs and She-IS Foundation for victim women of armed conflict in Colombia.

-  While working at the intersection of Gender and Productive Development Policies, I led processes of occupational empowerment for women, children and minority groups that required a great degree of participatory action and collaborative efforts among women and different stakeholders through bottom-up approaches. In doing so, we developed productive units, namely, microenterprises, in sectors such as textiles, handcraftings, coffee, cocoa, subsectors of palm oil, fruits, among others. Their products have been part of the primary assemblage of Global Value Chains (GVC), reaching out traders directly, diversifying their production and commercialization matrix and generating investment returns.

 - Proficient in Econometrics models and Impact Evaluation and Development Project Appraisal, and Inequality Measurement and Social Mobility.

- Proven working experience in conflict analysis, Humanitarian Affairs, transitional justice and Peacebuilding in-situ (fieldwork) operations.

 - Interested in the dimensions of social and economic sciences: Social mobility, income inequality, Gender, multidimensional poverty alleviation, labor market and productivity, public policy of competitiveness, Global Value Chains, bioeconomics, climate change, environmental planning.

certifications.name: Acreditación de Ponencia  - IV Congreso Centroamericano de Ciencias Políticas, Panamá

projects.title: Litro de Luz - Magdalena
projects.description: Litro de Luz es una iniciativa de innovación social a través de una botella transparente de plástico (PET) –rellena de agua mineral y cloro– que se inserta en orificios abiertos en los techos para aprovechar la luz exterior durante el día. La ONG My Shelter Foundation creó el nombre de este movimiento que hoy está también en Filipinas, India, Indonesia, Suiza, Brasil, México, Colombia, Egipto, entre otros países. En Colombia, dicho proyecto ha estado en ciudades como Bogotá, Cali, Cartagena, Barranquilla entre otras y ahora llega la Ciénaga Grande de Santa Marta y el Magdalena .

projects.title: Setting of an experimental system of floating cages for cultivating white shrimp in the coastal wetland, Ciénaga Grande de Santa Marta
projects.description: The project aimed at dealing with the environmental impact both the coastal lagoon and ecosystem known as Ciénaga Grande de Santa Marta - under RAMSAR and UNESCO category - and its inhabitants were living - and still do - due to a dynamic of organizational poverty, overexploitation of fishery resources, lack of institutional presence and ecological disaster. By training fishers and their families to grow shrimp in floating cages instead of fishing them, as well as generating opportunities for raising community environmental awareness, the project set out to educate Palmira and Palafitos town inhabitants to become entrepreneurs that take sustainable care of the biodiversity they earned a living from.

authors.headline: MADE51 Project Officer at WFTO | Program & Impact Evaluation | Social Business Researcher

profile_positions.description:
MADE51 is a global initiative led by UNHCR and implemented by WFTO that links refugee artisans in hosting countries with local social enterprises that work in the artisanal sector. MADE51 social enterprise partners are selected based on their proven experience in design, production management, export, and marketing.

These partnerships are the heart of MADE51. Based in refugee-hosting countries, each social enterprise works directly with refugee artisan groups to create a unique MADE51 range which is sold alongside the enterprise’s existing lines.

WFTO serves as the implementing partner by providing assistance in all areas contributing to the MADE51 Strategic Plan, ranging from administration & finances, disbursement of seed funding to local social enterprises and supporting the communications strategy.
profile_positions.title: MADE51 Project Officer

profile_positions.description:
•Carried out the Learning & Knowledge Evaluation of the entrepreneurship program  "InnovAction Challenge", a tailored program aiming to develop and accelerate SMEs and grassroots organizations affected by COVID-19 by providing entrepreneurial education and seed funding in the Latin American & The Caribbean Region.
•Produced four reports on the effectiveness, relevance and targeting of the program, using a qualitative-driven methodology and quasi-experimental impact evaluation methods.
•Generated a Learning & Knowledge Framework for three multilateral organizations.
profile_positions.title: Lead Consultant

company.name: International Institute of Social Studies (ISS) of Erasmus University Rotterdam

profile_positions.company: International Institute of Social Studies (ISS) of Erasmus University Rotterdam
profile_positions.description:
•Updated the databases of the Indices of Social Development (ISD 2020)
•Mapped, collected and analyzed statistical sources and evidence on Social progress on six indicators for over 180 countries.
•Analyzed and run regressions on STATA to observe indicators’ performance over time.
•Developed the content of tutoring guidelines of the Master class of Principles of Economic Development.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant

company.name: International Institute of Social Studies (ISS) of Erasmus University Rotterdam

profile_positions.company: International Institute of Social Studies (ISS) of Erasmus University Rotterdam
profile_positions.description:
- Carried out coordinating activities as a Facilitator of the General Course of the Master of Development Studies "Making of Development". The Learning methodology of the course enables 10 facilitators who hold workshop sessions to reinforce and hone in on students concepts, theories and approaches of development previously seen in classes. 
- During this process, I also conducted research related to the effects of the Migratory Policy in Colombia over Labor Market participation outcomes for venezuelan migrant workers who fled to the country as a result of the monetary, economic, political and humanitarian crisis in Venezuela.
profile_positions.title: Research And Teaching Assistant

company.name: Territorial Renovation Agency - Government of Colombia

profile_positions.company: Territorial Renovation Agency - Government of Colombia
profile_positions.description:
As part of the Ciénaga's Municipality and the Sierra Nevada-Serranía del Perijá Region, my role as co-facilitator was to lead the main actions within the rural territory for the participative design of Territorial-approach Development Plan (PDET, in spanish) upon 8 pillars of public policy orientation such as rural health, education, infrastructure, peace and reconciliation and agriculture production and economic reactivation. 

PDETs make part of the Peace Agreements Agenda, following the implementation of the Colombia's Integral Rural Reform.
profile_positions.title: Cofacilitator

profile_positions.description:
As a co-founder and project manager, I co-created the Social and Innovation Territorial Model for reconstructing victims women's human rights and economic autonomy, who suffered from the Internal Armed Conflict in Colombia. Likewise, I performed the following
responsibilities and duties:
- Planned and implemented annual action plans of the Foundation along Caribbean Sector
- Mapped prospective women entrepreneurs and get to engage them into the Social Innovation
Model that consisted in the acquisition of employability skills and business skills
- Carried out tailored gender-approach workshops as part of the strategy to transform their ideas
into viable and scalable business ideas.
- Developed a Global Value Chains and fair-trade strategy that promoted women's entrepreneurships and enterprises in international spheres and regional markets.
- Design and structure projects for international cooperation calls for funding.
- Some of women's products have been featured at the United Nations Headquarters in New York,
Inter-American Development Bank in Washington, the Inter-American Development Bank (IADB) and the Women Economic Forum in India and Bogotá.
profile_positions.title: Co Founder

profile_positions.description:
- Identified opportunities for promoting, channeling and developing sustainable business models led by young people that met two conditionalities: Ideas with tangible strength or an appealing value proposal, mainly focused on sorting out innovatively the bottlenecks or market and policymaking failures in traditional and non-traditional productive sectors in the Caribbean Region of Colombia and;
- Ideas with a strong component of both poverty alleviation and targeting impact on social mobility and inequality.
- Designed and implemented a methodology to develop social and productive innovation within young-led businesses and entrepreneurships initiatives.
- Worked with multistakeholder frameworks such as the Magdalena Entrepreneurship Ecosystem in  dynamizing the agenda for effective regional of Entrepreneurship and Employability. 
- Assessed businesses ideas, all-ages entrepreneurs, using different business structuration models.
- Taught business creation classes and workshops as a mentor and professor at the University of Magdalena.
- Crystallize fruitful partnerships with strategic stakeholders that allowed to position and grant reputability to Magdalena Emprende brand.
- Participated as a jury in different entrepreneurship models and events.
profile_positions.title: Businesses Unit Director

company.name: Cámara de Comercio de Santa Marta para el Magdalena

profile_positions.company: Cámara de Comercio de Santa Marta para el Magdalena
profile_positions.description: As a consultant, my main goal was to maximize the creation and capture of economic impact on Magdalena's entrepreneurs and enterprises by implementing charge-free, individual, long-term, confidential assessment and counselling, as well as tailored trainings, market research on a vast range of issues and topics for catering and meeting the needs of Micro, Small and Medium enterprises.
profile_positions.title: Consultant at the Small Business Development Center (SBDC)

company.name: Departamento Administrativo Nacional de Estadística - DANE Colombia

profile_positions.company: Departamento Administrativo Nacional de Estadística - DANE Colombia
profile_positions.description:
- I was part of a research team whose main job was to apply a detailed survey to non-residents tourists in order to characterize their consumption patterns profile at the port of arrival.
- Then, the information was collected, categorized and classified to arrange a report that allowed the country to know how to further design the goods, services and infrastructure it has been offering to international and non-residents travelers on the cruiseship-related tourism sector.
profile_positions.title: Researcher - Cruiseships International Travelers’ Survey Research (EVIC)

profile_positions.location: Magdalena, Santa Marta and Ciénaga (Caribbean Region)
profile_positions.description: Mi labor como Orientador Ocupacional estuvo enfocada en la formación educativa de más de 500 personas (Población en Pobreza Extrema y Desplazados) en la ciudad de Ciénaga, Magdalena en materia de competencias blandas ocupacionales para el Empleo y el Emprendimiento. Todo ello hace parte del programa Enrútate TU del Componente de Generación de Ingresos y Empleabilidad (GIE) del DPS. Este proceso consiste en la implementación de una ruta metodológica llamada Ruta de Atención Integral del RIE que permitia ir midiendo la apropiación social de conocimiento a la población con el fin de que se encuentren mejor y mayormente preparados para la búsqueda y/o obtención de un empleo o de llevar a cabo su propio emprendimiento. Tiene un fuerte componente de género al segmentar la focalización en mujeres madres cabezas de hogar, jóvenes en edad productiva y emprendedores con negocio.
profile_positions.title: Occupational Orientator on Employment and Entrepreneurship

company.name: Fundación Líderes y Emprendedores en la U
